content.text: He plans to keep twenty hens
He works out what he thinks this will cost

content.text: Show that the total cost is now $2040
Adam actually buys more than 20 hens, each costing $12
How many hens does he buy?
The ratio of costs is equipment: hens: feed = \(5:3:9\)
Adam makes \(\) 2920$ from selling his hens' eggs
Calculate his percentage profit on the \(\) 2040\$
Adam borrows \(\) 1500$ for 3 years at a rate of \(5.5\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the interest he will pay, correct to the nearest cent
Write down the mathematical name of the quadrilateral \(X\)
Describe fully the single transformation that maps quadrilateral \(X\) onto quadrilateral
Calculate the length of the longest side of quadrilateral \(X.\)
Show that your answer rounds to \(3.16 \text{cm}\), correct to 3 significant figures
The diagram shows four quadrilaterals drawn on a \(1\mathrm{~cm}^2\) grid
a square number that is odd,
a prime number which is one less than a multiple of 5
Using only the integers from 1 to 50, find
the size of one exterior angle,
the size of one interior angle
In the diagram, \(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are points on the circumference of a circle, centre \(O\)
\(AB\) is the diameter and \(EF\) is a tangent to the circle at \(A\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = 5 + 3x - x^2\) for \(-2 \leqslant x \leqslant 5\)
Use your graph to solve the equation \(5 + 3x - x^2 = 0\)
On the grid, draw the line of symmetry of \(y = 5 + 3x - x^2\)
Write down the equation of this line of symmetry
On the grid, draw a straight line from \((- 1, 1)\) to \((3, 5)\)
Work out the gradient of this line
Write down the equation of this line in the form \(y = mx + c\)
These are the averages for the number of runs scored by Bethan in the 15 matches
Alison says that her scores are better than Bethan's scores
Bethan says that her scores are better than Alison's scores
Explain how they could both be correct

Alison puts her 15 scores into 4 groups and shows them in a pie chart
Estimate the probability that in the next match Alison will score more than 25 runs
Give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form
Alison scored the following number of runs in 15 cricket matches

\(ABCD\) is the cross-section of a box
Calculate the volume of the box

The base and one face of the box have been drawn for you

Find an expression for the number of lines in Pattern \(n\)

(number of lines in Pattern \(n\))  (number of vertices in Pattern \(n\))
Here is a sequence of patterns made using identical polygons
To make \(r\) the subject of this formula, the first step is \(3V = \pi r^2 h.\)
Show the remaining steps to make \(r\) the subject of this formula
An ice-cream cone has a volume of \(141 \text{ cm}^3\) and height \(15 \text{ cm}\)
Show that the radius of the cone is \(3 \text{ cm}\), correct to the nearest whole number
The formula for the volume, \(V,\) of a cone with radius \(r,\) and height \(h,\) is \(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h\)
The open end of an ice-cream cone is a circle of radius \(3\mathrm{~cm}\)
Calculate the circumference of this circle

Calculate the cost of \(1 \text{ cm}^3\) of the ice-cream
